intro: Euchaetis elata, commonly known as the tall euchaetis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. Its leaves are ovate and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinct appearance. Euchaetis elata is often found in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
